programs.program_name: Bachelor of Science Accounting and Finance (3+0)

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level: BBB excluding General Studies.  Mathematics (minimum Grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: BBBBB (Grade B4 and above only).  Mathematics (minimum Grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM/UEC
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: BBB excluding General Studies.  Mathematics (minimum Grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM
entry_requirements_raw.IB Diploma: Pass with 30 points overall, 15 at Higher Level.  Standard Level/Higher Level in Mathematics (minimum grade 4) or Mathematics in IB MYP (minimum grade 5) or Mathematics (minimum grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM

course_content.core: Year 1 Introduction to Marketing Introduction to Accounting and Finance Introduction to Management Commercial Law Introduction to Economics For Non-Economists Financial Accounting I Management Accounting I Foundations of Business Analytics OR Management Analysis  Year 2 Company Law Principles of Audit and Taxation Business Research Financial Accounting 2 Financial Management Management Accounting 2 Portfolio Thoery and Financial Markets  Year 3 Financial Accounting 3 Management Accounting 3 Analytical Accounting Case Studies OR Dissertation

A-Level.text: BBB excluding General Studies.  Mathematics (minimum Grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM

UEC.text: BBBBB (Grade B4 and above only).  Mathematics (minimum Grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM/UEC

STPM.text: BBB excluding General Studies.  Mathematics (minimum Grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM

IB Diploma.text: Pass with 30 points overall, 15 at Higher Level.  Standard Level/Higher Level in Mathematics (minimum grade 4) or Mathematics in IB MYP (minimum grade 5) or Mathematics (minimum grade 6/B) in GCSE/SPM

programs.program_name: Bachelor of Science in Economics and Actuarial Science

entry_requirements_raw.UEC: BBBBB (Grade B4 and above only) including Mathematics.
entry_requirements_raw.IB Diploma: 30 points overall, 15 at Higher Level, including 5 points at Higher Level in Mathematics (Analysis and Approaches or Applications and Interpretation).

english_requirements.Others: SPM CEFR (Cohort from 2021): Level B2 or above

course_content.core: Year 1 Economics with Experiments Linear Algebra I Mathematics for Economics Foundations of Microeconomics OR Principles of Microeconomics Economics with Data Principles of Macroeconomics Quantitative Modelling in Economics Statistics for Economics Economics Skills and Employability I Year 2 Econometric Theory Financial Mathematics Intermediate Macroeconomics Intermediate Microeconomics ECON Dissertation: Prelim Info Econometrics with Big Data Economics Skills and Employability II Optional modules: Accounting and Finance for Non-Specialists (Actuarial Science) Stochastic Processes (Actuarial Science) Development Economics Dynamic Macroeconomics Applied Economics Year 3 Dissertation: Literature Review OR Project/Dissertation Dissertation: Research Project OR Dissertation: Research Topics Economics Skills and Employability III Optional Modules: Actuarial Mathematics I (Actuarial Science) Computational Economics (Actuarial Science) Survival Models (Actuarial Science) Actuarial Mathematics II (Actuarial Science) Mathematical Finance (Actuarial Science) Statistical Methods in Insurance (Actuarial Science) Labour Economics Principles of Finance Topics in Macroeconomics International Trade International Macroeconomics Public Economics

UEC.text: BBBBB (Grade B4 and above only) including Mathematics.

IB Diploma.text: 30 points overall, 15 at Higher Level, including 5 points at Higher Level in Mathematics (Analysis and Approaches or Applications and Interpretation).

programs.program_name: MEng Aeronautics & Astronautics (2+2), with University of Southampton, UK

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level: ABB/A*A*C/A*AC/AAC including grade A in Mathematics and grade A/B in Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: AAABBB, with A in Advanced Mathematics I & II, Physics and B in two other STEM subjects (Computing accepted).
entry_requirements_raw.IB Diploma: Pass with 32 points overall, with 16 points required at Higher Level, including 6 in Mathematics (Analysis and Approaches or Applications and Interpretation) at Higher Level and 6 in Physics at Higher Level.  IB English: 5 at Standard/Higher Level in IB English Language Syllabus A or 6 at Standard Level/5 at Higher Level in IB English Language Syllabus B.

english_requirements.IELTS: Band 1C, 6.5 overall with at least 5.5 in each component

course_content.core:
Year 1 An Introduction to Design
Mechanics, Structures and Materials
ThermoFluids
Electrical and Electronics Systems
Introduction to Aeronautics and Astronautics
Mathematics for Engineering and the Environment  Year 2 Systems Design and Computing
Engineering Management and Law
Mathematics for Engineering and the Environment Part II
Aerodynamics
Astronautics
Systems Design and Computing
Materials and Structures
Engineering Management and Law
Propulsion
Mechanics of Flight  Year 3 Individual Project
Aerothermodynamics
Aerospace Control Systems
Aircraft Structural Design Year 4 Group Design Project
Advanced Management

UEC.text: AAABBB, with A in Advanced Mathematics I & II, Physics and B in two other STEM subjects (Computing accepted).

subjects: Mathematics (Analysis and Approaches or Applications and Interpretation)

IB Diploma.text: Pass with 32 points overall, with 16 points required at Higher Level, including 6 in Mathematics (Analysis and Approaches or Applications and Interpretation) at Higher Level and 6 in Physics at Higher Level.  IB English: 5 at Standard/Higher Level in IB English Language Syllabus A or 6 at Standard Level/5 at Higher Level in IB English Language Syllabus B.

course_content.core:
Year 1 Introduction to Accounting and Finance 
Introduction to Management 
Introduction to Marketing 
Analytics Implementation I: Spreadsheets and Databases
Business Analytics Programming I: SAS Base Language
Predictive Analytics I: Regression and Combinatorial Techniques 
Prescriptive Analytics I: Fundamentals of Management Sciences 
Foundations of Business Analytics OR Management Analysis Year 2 Analytics Implementation II: Visualising Data for Effective Communication
Business Analytics Programming II: Algorithmic Thinking 
Consulting: Context, Concepts and Practice 
Predictive Analytics II: Business Forecasting 
Prescriptive Analytics II: Simulation Business Year 3 Analytics Implementation Ill: Knowledge Management, Methods and Ethics
Analytics in Action I 
Analytics in Action II 
Prescriptive Analytics Ill: Optimisation 
Final Project
